text: ; Our contracts dictate that these service providers only use your information in connection with the services they perform for us and not for their own benefit.

If you open an account, we collect the following information from you.
We process information on behalf of our customers who have legitimate interests in operating their businesses.
When a Calendar User comes to Calendar to schedule an event with a Calendar Member, you voluntarily give us certain information.

For example, with your consent, you may link your Calendar account with your Google, Gmail, Microsoft Office 365 account, iCal, Yahoo, AOL or other similar service, which allows us to obtain information from those accounts (like your basic profile or contacts).
To help us make emails more useful and interesting, we often receive a confirmation when you open email from Calendar if your computer supports such capabilities.

Like many websites, we and our service providers use cookies, web beacons and other technologies to receive and store certain types of information when you interact with us through your computer or mobile device subject to your opt-out preferences (see Your Rights and Choices section below).

Depending on how you're accessing our products and subject to your opt-out preferences, we may use "cookies" (a small text file sent by your computer each time you visit our website, unique to your Calendar account or your browser) or similar technologies to record log data.
For example, we may use cookies to keep you logged in to Calendar.
Like many websites, we and our service providers use cookies, web beacons and other technologies to receive and store certain types of information when you interact with us through your computer or mobile device subject to your opt-out preferences (see Your Rights and Choices section below).
We may use both session and persistent cookies.
When we use cookies, we may use "session" cookies (that last until you close your browser) or "persistent" cookies (that last until you or your browser delete them).
If you purchase any premium or enterprise version of Calendar, our third-party payment processors will collect and store your billing address and credit card information.
We store the last four digits of your credit card number, card type and the expiration date.
